content: The Act is titled the "Stopping Improper Payments to Deceased People Act" and pertains to the distribution of death information by the Social Security Administration. SEC. 4. PLAN FOR ENSURING ACCURACY AND COMPLETENESS OF DEATH DATA MAINTAINED BY SOCIAL SECURITY ADMINISTRATION. The Commissioner of Social Security, in consultation with the Secretary of Commerce, must submit a plan to Congress within 90 days of the enactment of the Act to ensure the accuracy and completeness of death data maintained by the Social Security Administration, including data on individuals not receiving benefits under titles II or XVI of the Social Security Act.
